= End to End Tournament Management Testing

All tests passed successfully with a 100% success rate. The tournament system is functioning correctly across all files.

== Test Results by Files

=== Bracket Tests

The bracket management system is working correctly with all core functionality validated.

.Passed Tests
|===
| # | Test Case
| 1 | Reset bracket recreates initial matches  
| 2 | Match status updates    
| 3 | undoMatchResult works as intended 
| 4 | Winner recorded correctly        
| 5 | Winner advances to next round       
| 6 | When team forfeits, winner is automatically deceided 
| 7 | Matches reordered correctly        
| 8 | Initial match creation    
| 9 | BYE created for odd number of teams  
| 10 | validateBracketIntegrity works as intended
|===
Status: 10/10 tests passed

Tournament team management and operations are functioning as expected.

=== Match Progression Tests

Bracket simulation and match progression are functioning correctly.

.Passed Tests

|===
| # | Test Case
| 1 | Run bracket returns rounds and results
| 2 | Run bracket handles BYE
|===


.Sample Match Progression Output
----
--- Round 1 ---
D (89) vs B (44)
Winner: D
C (38) vs A (138)
Winner: A
Next round match created: D_vs_A

--- Round 2 ---
D (60) vs A (3)
Winner: D

Champion: D
----

Status: 2/2 Tests passed

=== Bracket Visualization Tests
Bracket Visualization Tests outcome processing are working correctly.
.Passed Tests

|===
| # | Test Case
| 1 | Run bracket handles 8 teams
| 2 | Run bracket returns results array
| 3 | Run bracket returns final winner object
| 4 | Multiple rounds for 8 teams
| 5 | Run bracket handles 2 teams
| 6 | Results array returned
| 7 | Final winner exists
| 8 | First round has 1 match
| 9 | Run bracket handles odd number of teams
| 10 | Results array returned
| 11 | Final winner exists
| 12 | Run bracket handles single team
| 13 | Results array returned
| 14 | Single team becomes champion
| 15 | Run bracket returns rounds array
| 16 | Run bracket returns results array
| 17 | Run bracket returns final winner object
|===

.Sample Bracket Visualization Output
----
--- Round 1 ---
Team D (58) vs Team G (16)
Winner: Team D
Team H (20) vs Team A (111)
Winner: Team A
Next round match created: team-4_vs_team-1
Team C (40) vs Team F (55)
Winner: Team F
Team B (111) vs Team E (5)
Winner: Team B
Next round match created: team-6_vs_team-2

--- Round 2 ---
Team D (10) vs Team A (8)
Winner: Team D
Team F (149) vs Team B (12)
Winner: Team F
Next round match created: team-4_vs_team-6

--- Round 3 ---
Team D (110) vs Team F (10)
Winner: Team D

Champion: Team D
----


== Key Features Validated

=== Bracket Management
*  Initial match creation and pairing
*  Winner recording and advancement
*  Forfeit handling
*  Match status updates
*  Bracket reset functionality
*  BYE handling for odd team counts
*  Match reordering capabilities

=== Tournament Operations  
*  Team addition and removal
*  Participant management for single tournaments
*  Team search functionality
*  Tie resolution system

=== Registration System
*  Event state management (open/closed)
*  Team registration validation
*  Duplicate registration prevention

=== Match Simulation
*  Complete bracket progression
*  Automatic BYE handling
*  Champion determination
*  Round-by-round simulation

=== Result Processing
* Tournament outcome reporting
*  Placement determination
*  Winner validation

=== Bracket Visualization
*  8-team tournament support
*  Odd team count handling
*  Single team edge case
*  Two-team minimal bracket
*  Round progression tracking
*  Champion identification
*  Results array generation
